# Ghost — Private Local AI Assistant

> Ghost is a private, local-first AI assistant for desktop (Windows, macOS, Linux).
> It indexes local files, provides hybrid semantic + keyword search, and evolves
> into an AI agent that can take actions on your OS — all without sending data to the cloud.

## Key Facts

- **License**: MIT (open source core) + proprietary Pro tier
- **Stack**: Tauri v2 (Rust backend) + React/TypeScript (frontend) + SQLite/sqlite-vec + Candle (native AI)
- **Privacy**: 100% local. Zero telemetry. Zero cloud dependencies.
- **Current Version**: 0.2.x
- **Platforms**: Windows (x64), macOS (ARM64 + Intel), Linux (DEB, RPM, AppImage)

## Architecture

Ghost uses a 4-layer architecture:

1. **Frontend**: React/TypeScript with Tailwind CSS v4
2. **IPC Bridge**: Tauri v2 command system
3. **Core Engine (Rust)**: File watcher, text extractor, embedding engine, vector DB, search
4. **AI Layer (Local)**:
   - Native: Candle + all-MiniLM-L6-v2 (384D embeddings, ~23MB)
   - Fallback: Ollama + nomic-embed-text (768D)
   - Chat: Qwen2.5-Instruct GGUF (0.5B–7B, auto-selected by RAM)

## Core Features

- **Hybrid Search**: FTS5 keyword + sqlite-vec KNN vector search combined via Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF)
- **Native AI Inference**: In-process BERT embeddings via Candle — no Ollama, no GPU, no internet required after first model download
- **Spotlight-like UX**: Ctrl/Cmd+Space floating window, auto-hide, keyboard-first
- **File Indexing**: PDF, DOCX, XLSX, TXT, Markdown, 50+ code file types
- **Chat**: Native GGUF inference with hardware-aware model auto-selection
- **Zero-config**: Auto-discovers user directories on first launch
